data.title: Catalytic Microparticles
data.statement:
<<Tʀɪᴛᴏɴ SᴘᴀᴄᴇWᴏʀᴋs>> manufactures <<microscopic beads>> of a lightweight <<trinium alloy>> with a brittle isometric crystalline structure. When suspended in water or other solvents, the beads serve as a chemical catalyst in the industrial production of certain neutronium compounds.

Due to the high price of trinium, R&D is investigating different <<geometric forms>> to reduce the materials cost, improve the efficacy of the catalytic reaction, and potentially expand the market.

To evaluate each design proposal, a <<sliced schematic>> for the 3D metal printer will be presented, where each character represents one cubic micron of space, either {{o}} as empty or {{#}} to denote material. Every candidate shape is completely connected and structurally sound, but will typically be <<hollow>> with one or more interior cavities.
`
                                       ____________ ₁
     1      2      3      4      5    |`. —_—_—_—_—_⟍²₃
#####  #####  #####  #####  #####     |!.`. —_—_—_—_—_⟍⁴₅
#####  #ooo#  #ooo#  #ooo#  #####     |'!!.`————————————.
#####  #ooo#  #ooo#  #ooo#  #####     |!.'!|            |
#####  #ooo#  #ooo#  #ooo#  #####     |'!!.|            |
#####  #####  #####  #####  #####     |!.'!|    5 x 5   |
                                       `!!.|            |
            Schematic                    `!|            |
                                           `————————————'

                                       Commercial Product`
Determine the active <<surface area>> exposed anywhere along the form's exterior, the <<volume of solid material>>, and the <<bulk volume>> including any enclosed void. Report to four decimal places the relative [[activity]] as the ratio of surface area to solid volume, and the relative [[density]] as the ratio of solid to bulk volume.

As illustrated in the example, the current bead is a sealed hollow cube with a 5 micron side length. This has an easily verifiable surface area of 150 square microns, 25 for each of six sides. The solid volume is 98, and the bulk volume 98 + 27 = 125 cubic microns. So the relative [[activity]] is 150 / 98 ≈ {{1.5306}}, and the relative [[density]] is 98 / 125 = {{0.7840}}.

Since the trinium alloy has a physical density around 1.3 g/mL, this makes the square beads neutrally buoyant in saline water. While this is less ideal than distilled water, larger cubes with lower density also have lower activity. In contrast, a tube or other open form with high activity sinks quickly. Your team is optimistic that some proposals could improve not only the buoyancy, but also the proportion of reactive surface.
`

data.stubGenerator:
read L:int W:int H:int
loop L loopline H row:word(W)
write activity density
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> Three space-separated integers [[L]], [[W]], and [[H]] for the length, width, and height of the schematic
<<Next [[L]] lines:>> A string [[row]] of {{o}} and {{#}} characters for each slice (of which there are [[H]], each of length [[W]], separated by spaces)
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> Two space-separated values for the [[activity]] and [[density]], rounded and printed to four decimals

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Tʀɪᴛᴏɴ SᴘᴀᴄᴇWᴏʀᴋs manufactures microscopic beads of a lightweight trinium alloy with a brittle isometric crystalline structure. When suspended in water or other solvents, the beads serve as a chemical catalyst in the industrial production of certain neutronium compounds.

Due to the high price of trinium, R&D is investigating different geometric forms to reduce the materials cost, improve the efficacy of the catalytic reaction, and potentially expand the market.

To evaluate each design proposal, a sliced schematic for the 3D metal printer will be presented, where each character represents one cubic micron of space, either o as empty or # to denote material. Every candidate shape is completely connected and structurally sound, but will typically be hollow with one or more interior cavities.

                                       ____________ ₁
     1      2      3      4      5    |`. —_—_—_—_—_⟍²₃
#####  #####  #####  #####  #####     |!.`. —_—_—_—_—_⟍⁴₅
#####  #ooo#  #ooo#  #ooo#  #####     |'!!.`————————————.
#####  #ooo#  #ooo#  #ooo#  #####     |!.'!|            |
#####  #ooo#  #ooo#  #ooo#  #####     |'!!.|            |
#####  #####  #####  #####  #####     |!.'!|    5 x 5   |
                                       `!!.|            |
            Schematic                    `!|            |
                                           `————————————'

                                       Commercial Product

Determine the active surface area exposed anywhere along the form's exterior, the volume of solid material, and the bulk volume including any enclosed void. Report to four decimal places the relative activity as the ratio of surface area to solid volume, and the relative density as the ratio of solid to bulk volume.

As illustrated in the example, the current bead is a sealed hollow cube with a 5 micron side length. This has an easily verifiable surface area of 150 square microns, 25 for each of six sides. The solid volume is 98, and the bulk volume 98 + 27 = 125 cubic microns. So the relative activity is 150 / 98 ≈ 1.5306, and the relative density is 98 / 125 = 0.7840.

Since the trinium alloy has a physical density around 1.3 g/mL, this makes the square beads neutrally buoyant in saline water. While this is less ideal than distilled water, larger cubes with lower density also have lower activity. In contrast, a tube or other open form with high activity sinks quickly. Your team is optimistic that some proposals could improve not only the buoyancy, but also the proportion of reactive surface.

                ..../   /   /_________/\                     5\..

                                    Material Slices
Input
Line 1: Three space-separated integers L, W, and H for the length, width, and height of the schematic
Next L lines: A string row of o and # characters for each slice (of which there are H, each of length W, separated by spaces)
Output
Line 1: Two space-separated values for the activity and density, rounded and printed to four decimals
Constraints
0 < H ≤ W ≤ L < 20
Example
Input
5 5 5
##### ##### ##### ##### #####
##### #ooo# #ooo# #ooo# #####
##### #ooo# #ooo# #ooo# #####
##### #ooo# #ooo# #ooo# #####
##### ##### ##### ##### #####
Output
1.5306 0.7840
